page.title: 04SHINTY-A HIGHLAND GAME
page.content: In Kiltarlity we have a sport called {shinty}.You use a club which is shaped like a hockey stick but you can hit with both sides .The shinty ball is a cork or string centre and a leather casing and is the same size as a tennis ball. There are twelve players in a team. Lovat shinty club has been around for over one hundred years.Lord Lovat is the chief of the Lovat shinty club. The game looks wilder than hockey because you can swing over your head and you are allowed to turn your back on your opponent. Shinty's Gaelic name is camanachd and the club is called a caman.The sport is completely amateur. Lovat shinty club have teams for adults and juveniles.This year the primary school team and the under 14 team were cup winners.
